content:
For future reference, this puzzle is a sequel to the puzzle "2B XOR NOT 2B"
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/188195a5500fd29e9c6cd31e4124a90755a5

I solved it and I like it, but I'm refusing as CoC.

IMHO, it's just a bit too much: the implementation likely tends to fit in the allotted time, but there are too many small details to doubt about when reading the statement, and I don't think that's good fun for a CoC.

If you'd consider resubmitting as an easy puzzle, I'd have a few more comments, but we'll see then.
In the case single line with 12 characters, why the answer is 6? I think it must be 7.

is this problem even solvable in reverse mode?

I tackled without looking at the statement, initially thought its just a sum of # of digits between stars and I was so wrong.

Then I started reading the statement which then took me about 5 minutes to understand the problem itself lol.
I thought 2nd and 3rd test cases were giving it away, I've removed the reverse mode
I think the second line is the "M", # of column (not enemy ship)
Makes sense, like I said before, I'm fine with both modes. What kind of small details did you doubt about?
Most of it would make the statement longer, so no point for a clash. The gist of it falls along the lines of: context setting; actual allowed operation; result meaningfulness.

This is really a fun puzzle. I think this is more suitable for an <<Easy>> Classic Puzzle rather than CoC. I personally did not solve this in 15 minutes and it made all sense after I saw your solution :)

I guess I went down to the wrong rabbit hole as I created a matrix of the map and started to figure out the first hit by nearest hit from the enemy coordinate :$

Most of the time, I skip the question description as well, just trying to understand the question by looking at its inputs and outputs. But it backfires time to time and this puzzle is one of them, it backfires so hard. I believe that it's solvable under 15 mins if read carefully. I can turn it to a classic puzzle if many people complain about its hardness. But tbh, it'd be way too easy for a classic puzzle. I feel like it's in-between

I agree with stalk-me, it took me a while to understand the statement itself, which does make a good job at explaining the problem, and maybe it is a bit too long for CoC, but I do think it is a bit too long for Fastest CoC just because of the entertainment value, it is my opinion that those in fastest should be solvable in 5 mins at most. But great contribution, tho. Hope it gets accepted.
Feel free to reject if you truly think it's too long for CoC. I can convert it to a classic puzzle by adding some twists to it. I'm completely dependent on what the community wants
I actually upvoted. Really liked it, was just commenting on whether it should be on Fastest.
